bug.short_desc: The old status bar should should be visible if the user so wishes in Firefox 4

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
I want the status bar back in Firefox 4, as an OPTION in the View->Toolbars menu. If you just don't do this, i'm done with firefox, and i'll make sure to drag as many people with me away from fx as i possibly can ("direct marketing", blogs, you name it).
This is INSANE what you're doing, to just cut such a core piece of a browser's UI that users have been used to for decades. INSANE.
------ PS I know that others have posted quite a bunch of issues on this topic, but i'm still adding a new one, because you guys should really wake up in terms of how you treat your public (or you're gonna be at 5% browser share in 2 years from now, you's no longer the only option around you know).
Reproducible: Always
Actual Results: The visibility of the status bar should be an option in the View menu
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 602237 ***
thanks sdrocking, i'll try it, maybe fx will stand another chance on my laptop after all. maybe. (still, this doesn't make the UI design change utterly insane)
